column1: Coronel is a Chilean city and commune
column2: located in the Concepción Province of the eighth region of Bio Bío.

column1: The city of Coronel is located in a sandy platform that goes from the mouth of the Biobío River to the Arauco Gulf bay

column2: forested landscape enclosed by high mountains was what the first Spanish conquistadors and settlers found when arriving. Vegetation and forests covered most of the area except very close to the coast. This type of landscape is characteristic of the province.

column1: The total area of the commune is 279.4 km2 (108 sq mi). Aside from its western coast along the Pacific Ocean
column2: the commune is surrounded by other communes of the Concepción Province: San Pedro de la Paz to the north
column3: Hualqui to the north and east
column4: and Lota and Santa Juana to the south.

column1: Santa María Island also forms part of the city
column2: which is represented there by a municipal delegate.

column1: The climate of Coronel is temperate Mediterranean
column2: common to the Chilean Coast Range
column3: with moderate temperature variations.  As Coronel is situated west of the mountain range
column4: it generally receives winds out of the west and northwest
column5: and increased precipitation due to orographic lift.  Its proximity to the Pacific influences its annual temperature variations. The average temperature in summer is 17 °C (63 °F) and 8 °C (46 °F) in winter.

column1: Like all territory to the south of Biobío River
column2: this area was populated by the Mapuche. Historically
column3: Spaniards called them as Araucaníans (araucanos) and their coastal territory as Araucanía.

column1: This territory is a part of the Kingdom of Araucania and Patagonia
column2: an unrecognised state established on November 19

column1: The indigenous population of Coronel Bay was located into a war zone called Butanmapu de la costa.  From the descriptions made by the Spaniards
column2: it is probable that before the Spaniards' colonization
column3: half of the Mapuche population lived in this region. Also
column4: the population density of the tribes was evenly distributed on both east and west sides of the Cordillera de Nahuelbuta

column2: Coronel is a third-level administrative division of Chile administered by a communal council
column3: headed by an alcalde who is directly elected every four years. The 2012-2016 alcalde is Leonidas Romero. The communal council has the following members:
